nodes.bodyText:
rather than having a callback here, it's cleaner to have this function simply return the observable and let whoever is calling it to subscribe to the actual response. When you do this, you can't handle errors in the API.
I see that you are transforming the response, so you can use map operator to the response of the observable before returning it
I've made the change to use an observable instead of a callback. There isn't any real error handling yet, though.
nit: i think in this case using ternary operator might be slightly more efficient since we won't need to render additional components
don't use optional chaining quite yet. It's still in draft proposal stage and still considered experimental
provide version ranges for all versions in this file. Otherwise we will have to update the version every time
